name: Egnyte
description: Add an Egnyte Instance to connect your existing Egnyte account to the Cloud Storage and Documents Hub, allowing you to manage files and folders. You will need your Egnyte account information to add an instance.

configuration.name: The Egnyte Subdomain
configuration.description: Subdomain of your company, ex: https://abc.egnyte.com, the subdomain will be abc

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Document Hub Tagging
configuration.description: Enable Tagging of Documents. Paths and Tags will be stored in CE database in Clear Text

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }

resources.description: Get the current event cursor position
Get the events of the instance

parameters.name: file_system
parameters.description: The type of events we want to capture

parameters.name: last_event_id
parameters.description: The current cursor value

resources.description: Deletes a file from your cloud service by its specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the file should also be deleted from trash

resources.description: Retrieves a single file from your cloud service from a specified path. The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Uploads a file to your endpoint cloud service.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

parameters.name: multipart/form-data
parameters.description: The content type for file upload

resources.description: Copies a file specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source file path does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created. Copying a file that already exists overwrites the file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the new file

parameters.name: copy
parameters.description: The copy action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination file. Path is required

resources.description: Deletes a file from your cloud service by its specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Deletes a specific file associated with an ID from your cloud service using its specified path.

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the file should also be deleted from trash

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

resources.description: Retrieves a specific file associated with an ID from your cloud service from a specified path.  The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

resources.description: Copies a file associated with an ID from a specified file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source file associated with an ID does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist they will be created. Copying a file that already exists overwrites the file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the new file

parameters.name: copy
parameters.description: The copy action

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination file. Path is required

resources.description: Returns a link associated with an ID that can be used to download the specified file through Cloud Elements. The link can be used to download the file without providing credentials.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

resources.description: Retrieves specific metadata on a file associated with an ID from your cloud service using its specified path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

resources.description: Update a file's metadata (path) associated with an ID. The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a file as well as move a file by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a file.

parameters.name: move
parameters.description: The move action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The new path of the file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The file's group_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the fields to update. Valid values include path.

resources.description: Find the revisions of a file associated with a given ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Group ID

resources.description: Retrieves the revision details of a file associated with a revision ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Group ID

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The Entry ID

resources.description: Returns a link that can be used to download the specified file through Cloud Elements. The link can be used to download the file without providing credentials.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Returns a link that can be used to download the specified file through Cloud Elements. The link can be used to download the file without providing credentials.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Retrieves the metadata from a single file on your cloud service from a specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Update a file's metadata (path) associated with a path.  The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a file as well as move a file by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a file.

parameters.name: move
parameters.description: The move action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The new path of the file

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the fields to update. Valid values include path.

resources.description: Retrieves the metadata from a single file on your cloud service from a specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Find the revisions of a file associated with a given path

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Retrieves the revision details of a file from a specified path

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: revisionId
parameters.description: The Entry ID

resources.description: Deletes an entire folder from your cloud service by its specified path. The folder specified is deleted from your cloud service.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the folder should also be deleted from trash

resources.description: Creates a new folder on your cloud service using its specified path. Creation of the new folder goes through Cloud Elements. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist they will be created. Creating a folder that already exists results in an error response.

parameters.name: add_folder
parameters.description: Action for create folder

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the new folder

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object with the fields to create. Valid values include path

resources.description: Get a list of CloudFiles that are contained in a specified folder on your cloud service specified by a path.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 50 if not supplied

resources.description: Copies a folder specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source path does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created. Copying a folder that already exists results in the folder being overwritten.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the new folder

parameters.name: copy
parameters.description: The copy action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the existing folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination folder. Path is required

resources.description: Deletes a file from your cloud service by its specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

resources.description: Deletes an entire folder associated with an ID from your cloud service.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the folder should also be deleted from trash

resources.description: Retrieves a list of CloudFiles that are contained in a specified folder associated with an ID on your cloud service via a specified path.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 100 if not supplied

resources.description: Copies a folder associated with an ID specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source path does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created. Copying a folder that already exists results in the folder being overwritten.

parameters.name: copy
parameters.description: The copy action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the new folder

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination folder. Path is required

resources.description: Retrieves specific metadata on a folder associated with an ID from your cloud service using its specified path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

resources.description: Update a folder's metadata (path) associated with an ID.  For example, if you had the ID of a folder that was located in the operations directory, but needed to be moved into the legal directory, then you would perform a PATCH using the path JSON field to update the path.  The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a folder also by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a folder.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The new path of the folder.

parameters.name: move
parameters.description: The move action

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the field to update. Valid values include path.

resources.description: Retrieves specific metadata on a folder from your cloud service using its specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

resources.description: Update a folder's metadata (path) associated with its path.  For example, if you had a folder that was located in the operations directory, but needed to be moved into the legal directory, then you would perform a PATCH using the path JSON field to update the path. The PATCH method can update the name or directory path of a folder also by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a folder.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the existing folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: move
parameters.description: The move action

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The new path of the folder.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the field to update. Valid values include path.

resources.description: Retrieves specific metadata on a folder from your cloud service using its specified path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

resources.description: Performs a text search.  The search uses substring matching so searching for "exam" will match on "example.txt".  Subdirectories are also searched.  The search returns a list of CloudFiles that match search parameters.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 100 if not supplied

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text in the file or folder name

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, end date is required. Date should be of the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ" (ISO-8601), eg. 2015-01-14T22:19:29Z

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, start date is required. Date should be of the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ" (ISO-8601), eg. 2015-01-14T22:19:29Z

resources.description: Retrieves the amount of storage available on your cloud service account.
Delete the file/folder id from trash

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: ids of the files/folders to purge

parameters.name: PURGE
parameters.description: The PURGE action

resources.description: Find the file/folder id from trash
